page.title: 13Housing in Haverfordwest (2)
page.content: The Council have built 4 large housing estates mostly of semi-detached properties but with some terraced houses. Recently some of these houses have been sold to sitting tenants. There are two estates of service houses and flats, owned by the Government and inhabited by servicemen from R.A.F. Brawdy. There is little other evidence of flat or apartment type dwellings except above the businesses in town. There has been a policy to renovate old properties with Government grants being issued.The old buildings of St. Thomas's Hospital have recently been converted into flats for the use of one parent and homeless families. It is rare to find more than one family unit living in one house. Occasionally one aged parent may reside with a family.
